question: Which country houses the "Aburi Botanical Gardens"?
explanation: Aburi Botanical Gardens is a botanical garden in Aburi in Eastern region of South Ghana. It was opened in 1890 and was founded by Governor William Brandford-Griffith and Dr John Farrell Easmon. The gardens played an important role in encouraging cocoa production in South Ghana, by supplying cheap cocoa seedlings and information about scientific farming methods.
